edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.validator

Class CourseNameValidatorFSM

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc216.pack_scheduler.course.validator.CourseNameValidatorFSM

  • public class CourseNameValidatorFSM
extends java.lang.Object
    Finite State Machine for checking whether a Course's Name is valid.
    Author:
    Jason King, Sarah Heckman

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int state
      The state variable keeps track of the current FSM state we are in
      private int stateD
      State at which one digit has been identified
      private int stateDD
      State at which two digits have been identified
      private int stateDDD
      State at which three digits have been identified

      Initial state before input is examined
      private int stateL
      State at which one letter has been identified
      private int stateLL
      State at which two letters have been identified
      private int stateLLL
      State at which three letters have been identified
      private int stateLLLL
      State at which four letters have been identified
      private int stateSuffix
      State at which a suffix letter has been identified

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid(java.lang.String courseName)
                throws InvalidTransitionException
        Returns true if the course name is valid, based on a string matching Finite State Machine. The course name must match the following format: (1-3 letters)(3 digits)(optionally, a 1 letter suffix)
        Parameters:
        courseName - the name of the course
        Returns:
        true if the course name is valid, or false if the course name is invalid
        Throws:
        InvalidTransitionException - when the FSM attempts an invalid transition
